DOC.brief_summary: The aim study integrate gaze training intervention ( i.e. , quiet eye training ; QET ) show improve throw catch skill child Developmental Coordination Disorder ( DCD ) , within approach ( i.e. , group therapy ) might alleviate psychosocial influence motor skill deficit .
DOC.brief_title: The Effects Group-based Gaze Training Intervention Children With Developmental Coordination Disorder
DOC.detailed_description: Children DCD randomly split either QET group technical training ( TT ) . The TT group give movement-related instruction via video , relate throw catch phase , QET group also teach fixate target location wall prior throw ( QE1 ) track ball prior catch ( QE2 ) . Each group take part 4- week , group therapy intervention measurement QE duration obtain mobile eye track system catch performance take training , 6-week delay retention test . Parental feedback psychosocial motor skill outcomes also collect delayed retention .
